fileDesc.extent: Approx. 12KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 4 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal licence. The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

seriesStmt.title: Early English books online text creation partnership.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1641-1700 ; 1308:25)
Order of Parliament naming committees to execute the Ordinance for raising money for maintenance of the Parliamentary army.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

keywords.term: Great Britain -- History -- Civil War, 1642-1649 -- Pamphlets.

revisionDesc.change: 2014-03 Apex CoVantageKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2014-09 Mona LogarboText and markup reviewed and edited

div.p:
WHereas in the Ordinance of both Houses of Parliament lately passed, for the speedy raising and levying of money, for the maintenance of the Army rais'd by Parliament by taxing such as have not contributed, or lent at all towards the maintenance of the said Army, or if they have, yet not in any reasonable measure answerable to their estates, divers persons therein appointed Committees are misnamed, and divers persons fit to further the Execution of the same Ordinance are omitted to be therein named to be Committees, whereby the service (if it be not remedied) is like to be much retarded and hindred. It is therefore ordered and
Ordained by the Lords and Commons in Parliament, that the severall persons here under-named, shall be Committees for the executing of the said Ordinance, in the severall counties, cities, and places, for which they are hereby herein nominated & appointed, viz.)

Suffolk. For the County of Suff'. Sir Edmond Bacon, Sir William Playters, Knights and Baronets, Sir Butts Bacon, Sir William Springe Baronets, Sir Roger North, Sir William Soame, Sir Nathaniel Barnardiston, Sir Philip Parker, Sir John Wentworth, Sir Robert Brooke, Sir Thomas Barnardiston, Knights, William Heveningham, Maurice Barrowe, Thomas Baker, Henry North, sen. Brampton Gurdon, Henry North junior, Nicholas Bacon, Nathaniel Bacon of Freston, John Clench of Creating, Thomas Terrell, Rob. Reynolds, Francis Bacon, William Cage, John Gurdon, Robert Brewster, Isaac Appleton, Nathaniel Bacon of Ipswich, William Bloyse, Thomas Cole, Richard Pepis, William Ryvet of Billson, John Clynch of Culpho, Theophilus Vaughan, Edmund Harvey, Esquires, Francis Brewster, and John Base, Gent.
For the Town of Ipswich, the Bayliff of the Town for the time being,Iohn Sicklemer, Richard Puplet, Iohn Aldus Gent. Nathaniell Bacon, Ioseph Pemberton, Robert Duncombe, Iacob Cale Gent.

For the Town of Bury Saint Edmonds, the Alderman of the Towne for the time being,
_____ Bright, Samuell
Moody, and Tho. Chaplyn, Gent.
For the Town of Aldeburgh, the Bayliffs of the towne for the time being,Squire Bench, and Thomas Iohnson, Gent.

Kent▪ For the county of Kent, Sir Richard Harders Baronet, Sir William Springate, Sir Edmond Moninge Baronet, Sir Iames Oxenden, Thomas Blechenden, Iohn Boys of Wingham, Thomas Westrowe, Lambert Godfrey, Mark Dixwell, Thomas Brodenoxe, Thomas Blenchenden, Thomas Dike, Richard Beale Esquires, added to the Committee for sequestrations.

Bedford. For the County of Bedford, Sir Beacham St. Iohn, Knight, Sir Thomas Alston Knight and Baronet, Sir Iohn Burgoyne, Baronet, Sir Oliver Luke, Sir Samuell Luke, Sir Roger Burgoyne Knights, Sir William Bryers Knight, William Duncombe, Robert Stanton, Thomas Rolte, Samuell Browne, Iames Beverley, Thomas Sadler, Lewis Munnox, Iohn Neale, Richard Cockayne, Richard Edwards, Humphry Fish, Iohn Vaxe, Edward Cater, Ralph Snagge, Francis Astrey Esquires, Peter Neale, Ralph Mallory, and Edmund Iones, Gent. Iohn Wells of Rath,
_____ Bagshaw of Basmeade, Gent.
The Major of the Towne of Bedford, for the time being, Francis Banister, Doctor of Physick, Iohn Wells, Iohn Sibley, Iohn Smith, Peter Neale, and Iohn Nodes, Gent.
Leicester For Leicestershire▪ Arthur Stavely, Thomas Cotton, Francis Hacker, Iohn Goodman Esq;
Nottingham. For the County of Nottingham, Iohn Hutchinson, Gervas Pigott Esquires.
For the Towne of Nottingham, Iames Chadwick, Esquire.
Norwich For the City and county of the City of Norwich, Iohn Thacker, Adrean Parmitor, Christopher Barret, Thomas Barker, Iohn Tooly Esquires, Henry Watts, and Livewell Sherewood, Aldermen.
Glocester For Glocestershire, Sir Iohn Seamer, Sir Robert Cooke Knights, Edward Stephens, Iohn Cotherington, Iohn George, Iohn Stephens, Samuell Cotherington, Silvanus Wood, and Henry Stephens Esq;.

Glocester city. For the City and county of the City of Glosester, the Major for the time being, Dennis Wise, William Singleton, Thomas Purge, Luke Nurse Aldermen, Henry Stephens, Silvanus Wood, William Shephard and William Selwyn Esquires.
Committees for the county of Glocester, for sequestring Delinquents Estates, William Ginse, William Sellwyn Esqui • es.

The Major for the time being of the city of Glocester, Iohn Hanbury, Iohn Fetti • place, Esq; Iohn Gifford, William Magowe, William Window, Robert Backhouse, Stephen Fowler, Grimbald Pauncefate, Will: Willson, William Parrey, Gent.

Essex. For the County of Essex, Sir Harbottle Grimston, Knight and Baronet, Sir Thomas Cheek Knight, Will: Massam, Henry Mildmey of Graves, Nath. Bacon, Robert Smith, Thomas Cooke, Henry Far, Carey Mildmay, Robert Wiseman, of Magland, Robert Bourne, Iohn Meed, Iohn Eden, Iohn Pike, Thomas Clapton, Arthur Barnardiston, Isaac Allen, of Hasley, William Atwood, Pet. Whitcomb, Ed: Berkhead, Ioh. Brook,
Hen: Wiseman, John Eldred, Rob: Young, John Watkins, Francis Stonhard, Esquires, John Sorrell, Ieremy Aylet, William Collard, Robert Crane, Robert Calthrope, John Alliston, William Harlackenden, Isaac Wyncoll, Samuell Plume, Iohn Fennynge, George Thorogood, Thomas Aylet of Keldon, Doctor Reade of Berdanger▪ Thomas Adams of Baxted, Richard Wiseman, William Turner of Wymbishe, Iohn Thurgood of Walden, Francis Williamson of Walden, and Thomas Cook Gent.

Essex. Committees added by the Lords and Commons to the Ordinance, for sequestring of Delinquents Estates in the Countie of Essex: Henry Myldemay of Craces, Nathaniell Bacon, Henry Farr, Cary Mildmaye, Doctor Reade of Birdanger, Iohn Eden, Thomas Clapton, Iohn Brook, Iohn Eldred, Iohn Pyke, Francis Stonenard, Io: Watkins, George Thorogood, Esquires, Thomas Cook, William Turner of Wimb she,Iohn Alliston, William Harlackenden, Thomas Adams of Thursted,Isaac Wincall, Samuel Plume, Iohn Fenninge, and Thomas Aylet of Kelden Gent.
For the Town of Colchester, Harbottle Grimston, Esquire, Recorder there, Master Iohn Langton, Master Rob: Buxton Gent. Master Ward Alderman, Tho: Johnson.
Middlesex. For the County of Middlesex, Sir Thomas Fowler Baronet, Sir Robert Barkham Knight,Iohn Huxly, Thomas Swallow, Sir Giles Overbury, Iohn Brown, Esq; Cler. Parl.
Dorset. For the County of Dorset, Richard Broddreppe, Richard Rose, Iohn Henley, Esquires,Thomas Cheek▪ and William Kerridge, Gent.
Berks. For the county of Berks, Sir George Stonehouse Baronet, Edmond Dunch Esq;.
Somerset. For the county of Sommerset, Clement Walker, Iohn Pyne, Henry Samford, Iohn Ashe Esq;.
Lincoln. For the parts of Holland in the county of Lincolne, Sir Thomas Trolope, Baronet, Morris Cave, Esquire, Iohn Browne, Captain Escotte, and Martin Iohnson Gent.

Hertford. Committees for Sequestring of the Estates of Delinquents in the county of Hertford, Edward Atkins Serjeant at Law, Iohn King Doctor in Physick, Henry Meawtis, sen. Thomas Tooke,Gabrell Barbor, Toby Combes, Iohn Pemberton, Litton Fairecloth, Iohn Scrogg, Tho: Sadler Esq;.
The Major of Hertford for the time being, Iohn Mash, Isaac Puller, Thomas Meade, William Carter of Offley Gent. Iohn Humborston sen. Gent.

Hereford Committees for the County of Heref. for sequestring the estates of Delinquents, Sir Iohn Kirle Baronet, Iames Kirle, Edward Harley, Martin Husbands, Ambrose Elton jun. Henry Iones of Maynson, in the Parish of Ledbury, Thomas Rawlyns Esq; Thomas Davies of Wigmore, Richard Nicholet▪ Francis Pember, Francis Hill, Samuell Trettma Gent.

Norfolk. Committees for the County of Norfolk. Iames Calthrop, Sherriff of the county of Norfolk. Thomas Lincolne, of Thetford Alderman, Sir Edward Barkham Knight and Baronet, William Heveningham, Miles Corbet, Iohn Gibbon, Philip Bedingfield, Sam. Smith, Tobias Fryar, Iames Scamblet, Robert Wilton, Esq; Henry King, Iohn Bruster, Richard
Harvye, Rich. Harvye, Master Russell, Robert Gooch, of Elham,Thomas Utber, William Coney, Master With, of Brodish, Iohn Berkham, Sucklin Day, Iohn Brown of Sparks, Robert Shephard, Thomas Iohnson, Iohn Iay of of Ersham, Richard Warner, of little Brand M. Walter, of Deram, Robert Ket of Wicklewood, Robert Felsham, of Sculthrop, Iohn Raymes of Oxtron, Francis Shouldham of Fulmerston, Sam. Money of Binnum, William Gasly of Holcan, Iohn Swalter of Southcreake, _____ Collyns of Blackborn Abby, Iohn Vincent of Crinisham, Ieremy Blofeild of Alby, Robert Dagly of Alsham. 〈◊〉 Clark of Gaywood, Tho: Springall of St. Maries, Robert Wood of Brook.
The Major of Norwich pro tempore, William Simonds of Norwich, Livewell Sherwood of Norwich, Aldermen.

These Persons herein named shall be Committees for the severall Counties, and places abovesaid, and shall have the same power and authority in the respective Counties and places, for which they are nominated as the other Counties named in the said Ordinance are hereby to have.

postscript.p: Ordered that these Additions be forthwith printed and published:

closer.signed: H: Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.
